channel.title: Comments on: The new HTML sanitizer in Rails 4.2
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Yorick
item.dc:creator: Yorick
item.description: Is this meant to be working in rails 4.2? I tried calling sanitize but i think it still calls the old deprecated sanitizer. If you look here (https://github.com/rails/rails-html-sanitizer/blob/master/lib/rails-html-sanitizer.rb#L33) it tries to override sanitizer_vendor but this method lives in the ClassMethods module so it has no effect.
item.content:encoded: Is this meant to be working in rails 4.2? I tried calling sanitize but i think it still calls the old deprecated sanitizer. If you look here (https://github.com/rails/rails-html-sanitizer/blob/master/lib/rails-html-sanitizer.rb#L33) it tries to override sanitizer_vendor but this method lives in the ClassMethods module so it has no effect.

item.title: By: Isaac Andrade
item.dc:creator: Isaac Andrade
item.description: Is the change compatible with Rails 4.1?

item.title: By: Rafael Mendonça França
item.dc:creator: Rafael Mendonça França
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/07/the-new-html-sanitizer-in-rails-4-2/comment-page-1/#comment-1425">Micah Geisel</a>.
We do avoid adding native dependencies on the Rails framework but for his case we chose to use they because Nokogiri bundle the dependencies inside the gem and it also already has binary distributions to JRuby and Windows platforms.
The easy to start / development workflow should not change.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Micah Geisel.

We do avoid adding native dependencies on the Rails framework but for his case we chose to use they because Nokogiri bundle the dependencies inside the gem and it also already has binary distributions to JRuby and Windows platforms.

The easy to start / development workflow should not change.
